SEARCH
Package MainProgram

Class CliHandler

java.lang.Object
MainProgram.CliHandler
class CliHandler extends Object
This class is where most interactions with the user should occur. It maintains a Scanner instance that can be used to capture user input. Because of this, it's close() method should be called when no longer in use.

  • Constructor Details

      public CliHandler()

  • Method Details

    • printTitle

      public void printTitle()

    • printMainMenu

      public int printMainMenu(Project selectedProject)
      Prints the main menu and returns the user's selection. This version of the menu requires a project to be selected because there are options that are only relevant when something is selected.
      Parameters:
      selectedProject - The project that is currently selected.
      Returns:
      The user's selection

    • printMainMenu

      public int printMainMenu()
      Prints the main menu and returns the user's selection. This version of the menu is called when there is no currently selected book and thus excludes any menu options that require a selection.
      Returns:
      The user's selection

    • addProject

      public Project addProject() throws DatabaseException
      The method called by selecting 'Add to Project' from the menu. Collects the information from the user and calls to the database as needed.
      Returns:
      The project that should be the new currently selected project.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If an error occurs when calling the database.

    • getBasicProjectInfoFromUser

      private Project getBasicProjectInfoFromUser() throws DatabaseException
      Called when the user selects "Add new Project" from the main menu. Collects the bare minimum information required to create a project record. The resulting project will not yet have a project number because it has not been added into the database yet.
      Returns:
      The resulting project object.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • chooseProjectType

      private ProjectType chooseProjectType()
      Asks the user to choose a project type from a list
      Returns:
      The selected type (Enum value).

    • findOrCreatePerson

      private Person findOrCreatePerson() throws DatabaseException
      Attempts to search for a person record using the name from the user as a search term. If possible matches are found, allows the user to select one. If the user doesn't select a person or no matches are found, proceeds to create a new record.
      Returns:
      The selected/created person
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • showCurrentProjects

      public Project showCurrentProjects(Project currentSelection) throws DatabaseException
      Finds and displays all projects that are not overdue or finalised then allows the user to select one.
      Parameters:
      currentSelection - The currently selected project. Will be displayed to assist the user. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The selected project
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • showOverdueProjects

      public Project showOverdueProjects(Project currentSelection) throws DatabaseException
      Finds and displays all overdue projects then allows the user to select one.
      Parameters:
      currentSelection - The currently selected project. Will be displayed to assist the user. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The selected project
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • showAllProjects

      public Project showAllProjects(Project currentSelection) throws DatabaseException
      Finds and displays all projects then allows the user to select one.
      Parameters:
      currentSelection - The currently selected project. Will be displayed to assist the user. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The selected project
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • searchDialog

      public Project searchDialog() throws DatabaseException
      Allows the user to search through the database records and select a project for further action. Gives the user the option to search by Project name, property address and person. The person can be any one of the actors (customers, project manager etc.) The users search string is passed to the appropriate method to search the database.
      Returns:
      A Project object representing the new selection.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs during the search.

    • getMenuChoice

      private int getMenuChoice(String prompt, int minChoice, int maxChoice)
      Helper method for getting user input for a menu and validating that it is within the range of values from the menu.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt displayed to the user asking for input.
      minChoice - The smallest acceptable integer input from the user.
      maxChoice - The largest acceptable integer input from the user.
      Returns:
      The user's selection.

    • printAndPickResult

      private Pickable printAndPickResult(List<Pickable> searchResults)
      Helper method to print out a list of Pickable objects (i.e. Projects or People) and ask the user to select one.


      Called on search results received from a database search method.

      Parameters:
      searchResults - A List of Pickable objects to select from.
      Returns:
      The selected Pickable. Typical you should cast this to the relevant object type afterwards.

    • updateMenu

      public Project updateMenu(Project selectedProject) throws DatabaseException
      Displays the update menu. This menu is used to change/enrich each project record but also to delete them or advance the status to the next stage.
      Parameters:
      selectedProject - The currently selected project which will be modified.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If an error occurs in the underlying database call.

    • updateProjectDetailMenu

      private Project updateProjectDetailMenu(Project projectToChange) throws DatabaseException
      Presents the user with a menu for editing the fields of a project (all the fields except the project status/stage). The menu is repeatedly shown to the user as they specify changes and the requested changes are buffered until the user indicates that they are done and wish to save their changes. Those changes are then submitted to the database in a single query.
      Parameters:
      projectToChange - The project being edited.
      Returns:
      A project object representing the new state. Set the selected project to this value.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • editPeople

      public void editPeople() throws DatabaseException
      Called from the main menu. Facilitates the process of editing an existing person's details.


      Allows the user to search for the person to edit and then displays a sub-menu asking for the specific value to change and the new value.


      There is no buffering of changes. Each change is executed on the database immediately.

      Throws:
      DatabaseException - if a database error occurs

    • personEditMenu

      private int personEditMenu(Person selectedPerson)
      Prints a menu showing all the possible elements of a person record that can be changed and returns the user's selection.
      Parameters:
      selectedPerson - The person that is going to be edited. To allow the menu to show the details of the record above the menu, aiding the user with their selection
      Returns:
      An integer matching the number in the menu of the user's selection.

    • getNewStringValueForUpdateMenu

      private String getNewStringValueForUpdateMenu(String promptPrefix, String oldValue, int maxLength, String lengthErrorMsg)
      Used when updating a string field in a Project record. Prints a prompt that shows the user what the previous value in the field was.
      Parameters:
      promptPrefix - The prompt to the user. Will be appended with a message containing the previous value.
      oldValue - The previous value. Can be null or blank if there was no previous value.
      maxLength - The maximum length of input allowed
      lengthErrorMsg - The error message to display if the user exceeds the maxLength. And '?' will be replaced with the value of maxLength
      Returns:
      The string input from the user.

    • getNewIntValueForUpdateMenu

      private int getNewIntValueForUpdateMenu(String promptPrefix, int oldValue, boolean zeroAllowed)
      Used when updating an integer field in a Project record. Prints a prompt that shows the user what the previous value in the field was.
      Parameters:
      promptPrefix - The prompt to the user. Will be appended with a message containing the previous value.
      oldValue - The previous value. Can be zero if there was no previous value.
      zeroAllowed - Whether or not zero is considered valid input.
      Returns:
      The integer input from the user.

    • getNewDecimalValueForUpdateMenu

      private BigDecimal getNewDecimalValueForUpdateMenu(String promptPrefix, BigDecimal oldValue, boolean zeroAllowed)
      Used when updating a decimal field in a Project record. Prints a prompt that shows the user what the previous value in the field was.
      Parameters:
      promptPrefix - The prompt to the user. Will be appended with a message containing the previous value.
      oldValue - The previous value. Can be zero if there was no previous value.
      zeroAllowed - Whether or not zero is considered valid input.
      Returns:
      The input from the user in a BigDecimal object.

    • getNewAssignee

      private Person getNewAssignee(Person oldPerson, String role) throws DatabaseException
      A method for asking the user who to assign to a role. Displays the old assignee to the user in the prompt. Initiates a search dialog to allow the user to select a person or create a new one.
      Parameters:
      oldPerson - The previous assignee. Can be null if there was no previous assignee.
      role - A String with the name of the role being assigned. Typical you can use the Project table column name.
      Returns:
      The new person to assign
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • deleteProject

      private boolean deleteProject(Project projectToDelete) throws DatabaseException
      Asks the user to confirm that they want to delete the given project and then does so if the answer is yes.
      Parameters:
      projectToDelete - The project to delete.
      Returns:
      true if the database is modified.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • getYesNoFromUser

      private boolean getYesNoFromUser(String prompt)
      Helper function to ask the user a yes/no question and collect their response.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The question the user is being asked.
      Returns:
      true if the user answers 'yes'. false otherwise.

    • getStringFromUser

      public String getStringFromUser(String prompt, int maxLength, String lengthErrorMsg, boolean acceptBlank)
      Helper method to get a String from the user with just a basic length validation check
      Parameters:
      prompt - The text to display prompting the user for input.
      Returns:
      The String from the user.

    • getStringFromUser

      public String getStringFromUser(String prompt, boolean acceptBlank)
      Helper method to get a String from the user without any validation checks
      Parameters:
      prompt - The text to display prompting the user for input.
      Returns:
      The String from the user.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the connection to the console. Should only be called once at the end of the program when no more input is needed from the user.
